text:
Some people think boundaries are restrictive. They struggle to say “no” directly, which can lead to feeling overwhelmed. 

But others see boundaries as freeing. They set clear rules ahead of time, so they don’t have to keep saying “no” later. ✌️

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Boundaries can be perceived as either constraining or liberating, with the latter allowing for pre-established rules that reduce the need for direct refusals.
